extension.name: Shell
extension.description: Framework for accessing Symphony via the command line

releases.release: - Added composer autoloader - Added shell-args package - Added Utils::promptForInput() which supports silent input capturing. Password will no longer echo to the display when using -u

- Checked compatiblity with Symphony 2.4+ - Using namespaces. - Updated command API. - Using SPL autoloader for all extension classes and loading commands from other extensions - Updated argument structure. Requires -c and -e before the command and extension values
- Fixed bug that ignored the '--usage' flag - Added username ('-u') option, which can be used instead of '-t'

- adding '--usage' after a command will trigger that commands 'usage()' function - added 'Shell::listCommands([$extension])' function for listing commands in the system - omitting a command will list all the commands available for that extension - omitting both extension and command will list all commands in the system - added "deny from all" '.htaccess' directive to the 'bin/' folder - 'test' command implements 'ShellCommand::usage()'
